item.title: India have 'unfair' advantage in Champions Trophy, say unhappy ex-Pakistan players - The Times of India
item.description:
Ex-Pakistan Players Criticize India's Advantage in Upcoming Champions Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

The upcoming ICC Champions Trophy in 2025 is raising concerns among former Pakistan cricketers, who feel that the tournament's hybrid model gives an unfair advantage to India.

  • The ICC Champions Trophy is set to return at the start of 2025.
  • India will play all its matches, including the semifinals and final if qualified, in Dubai.
  • Pakistan will host the remaining matches in Lahore, Karachi, and Rawalpindi.
  • Former players express concerns over India's favorable conditions and logistics.
  • The Champions Trophy will take place from February 19 to March 9, 2025, with a key match between India and Pakistan on February 23.
“India is the only team that knows where it will play the semi-finals and the final, while the other teams will only know that once the group stage is completed.” - Salim Altaf, former Pakistan bowler

The tournament setup has sparked debate and frustration among ex-Pakistani cricketers, who argue for a more equitable competition structure.

item.title: BCCI's new secretary told to send Agarkar 'strict message', drop Kohli and Rohit: 'They need to show they are not pawns' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI's new secretary told to send Agarkar 'strict message', drop Kohli and Rohit: 'They need to show they are not pawns'

Publication Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is set to have its first discussions on the future of senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma after a series of poor performances. New secretary Devajit Saikia has been instructed to convey a strong message regarding team selection.

  • India's poor performance: Six defeats in the last eight matches, raising concerns about the future of senior players.
  • Upcoming ICC Champions Trophy: India must submit a provisional team by January 12.
  • Calls for significant changes: Former officials suggest dropping Kohli and Rohit to reinforce that no player is bigger than the game.
The message is going very bad. People can be sweet pawns on the internet but BCCI has to run cricket in the country and it should also be seen running it.

In conclusion, the BCCI is at a crossroads regarding the roles of experienced players, and significant decisions are expected at the upcoming meeting.

item.title: ‘He’s sitting at NCA for I don't know how long': Ravi Shastri slams BCCI, blames them for Mohammed Shami's poor recovery - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Critiques BCCI Over Mohammed Shami's Injury Management

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has criticized the BCCI for their handling of Mohammed Shami's recovery, stating that he should have been taken to Australia for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Shastri believes Shami's presence would have impacted India's performance in Australia.
  • Shami has not played international cricket since the ODI World Cup final in November 2023.
  • BCCI ruled Shami unfit for the remainder of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to knee swelling.
  • Shastri expressed surprise at the communication regarding Shami's fitness and recovery process.
  • He suggested keeping Shami with the team in Australia for better rehabilitation.
“Where is he when it comes to recovery? He's been sitting in the NCA for I don't know how long.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri proposed that monitoring Shami's rehabilitation in Australia with professional guidance could have been beneficial for his recovery and the team's performance.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah told to 'forget playing for India' as defining SCG moment sparked workload concerns - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah told to 'forget playing for India' as defining SCG moment sparked workload concerns

Publication Date: Jan 07, 2025 10:17 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The article outlines Jasprit Bumrah's stellar performance in the Border-Gavaskar series despite injury concerns emerging from his heavy workload. He ended the series with 32 wickets and was named Player of the Series, but his absence in the final innings has raised alarms regarding his fitness and management.

  • Bumrah took 32 wickets in five matches, achieving three five-wicket hauls.
  • He bowled 151.2 overs in the series, with a peak of 53.2 overs in one match.
  • Concerns about workload management sparked debate in the cricketing community.
  • Former cricketer Balwinder Sandhu criticized the idea of workload management, encouraging players to focus on physical endurance.
"If a bowler can’t bowl 20 overs in an innings, he should forget about playing for India." - Balwinder Sandhu

This situation highlights the conflict between modern injury management practices in cricket and the traditional philosophies regarding player endurance.

item.title: People forget what Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have achieved in the past: Yuvraj Singh - The Times of India
item.description:
Yuvraj Singh Defends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli Amid Criticism

Publication Date: Not specified in the article. Source: Times of India

Former cricketer Yuvraj Singh spoke out in defense of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, expressing that people often forget their past achievements while criticizing their current performance. Amid India's recent loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, he emphasized their contributions to Indian cricket.

  • Yuvraj highlighted India's achievement of back-to-back victories in Australia.
  • Kohli struggled in the recent series, averaging 23.75 over eight innings.
  • Rohit opted out of a Test match due to his lean form, which Yuvraj called a sign of greatness.
  • He reminded fans of their significant victories and contributions in past tournaments.
“People forget what they have achieved in the past. They are two of the greatest cricketers of this time.” - Yuvraj Singh

Yuvraj concluded by emphasizing the importance of support for players during tough times, urging fans and the media to recognize their value beyond criticism.

item.title: 'He could have been the difference': Ravi Shastri and Ricky Ponting question Mohammed Shami's absence for - The Times of India
item.description:
Shastri and Ponting Critique Shami's Exclusion from BGT Squad

Publication Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri and Australian cricketing legend Ricky Ponting expressed disappointment regarding the absence of Mohammed Shami from the squad for the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. They believe his inclusion could have significantly changed the outcome of the series.

  • Shami was recovering from ankle surgery and showcased readiness through domestic red-ball cricket.
  • Swelling in his knee led the BCCI medical team to rule him out before the fourth Test.
  • Ravi Shastri criticized the clarity about Shami's fitness and suggested better communication regarding his condition.
  • Both Shastri and Ponting emphasized Shami’s potential impact on India’s bowling attack during crucial matches.
  • Shami is currently returning to form for the ICC Champions Trophy in February 2025.
“Why can't proper communication come out on where he stands? A player of his ability, I would have brought him to Australia.” - Ravi Shastri
“I was really surprised when he wasn't flown out even halfway through the series.” - Ricky Ponting

The absence of key players like Shami could have altered the series dynamics, indicating the importance of experienced bowlers in high-stakes matches.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah likely to miss England ODIs; in doubt for Champions Trophy - RevSportz
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Likely to Miss England ODIs; Doubts Surround Champions Trophy Participation

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: RevSportz

The Indian cricket team is concerned about Jasprit Bumrah's availability for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy following a back spasm he suffered during a match in Sydney. There are doubts about his participation in the upcoming ODI series against England.

  • Bumrah suffered a back spasm during Australia’s innings at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
  • His injury severity is still under assessment; no exact grade confirmed yet.
  • He is expected to miss the ODI series against England starting February 9.
  • Bumrah's injury status will be re-evaluated once he returns to India.
  • There are optimistic expectations that he may still join the ICC Champions Trophy squad if deemed fit.
  • The selection committee is set to announce the squad for the ODI series and Champions Trophy on January 12.
“A little frustrating (on injury) but sometimes you have to respect your body.” - Jasprit Bumrah

In conclusion, Bumrah’s fitness remains a critical factor as the team prepares for the ODI series and Champions Trophy, with updates expected soon from medical staff.

item.title: Rohit Sharma’s 'I'm not going anywhere' remark gets ignored by BCCI ahead of SGM: 'He was looking for escape route...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI Ignores Rohit Sharma's Retirement Clarification Ahead of Meeting

Date: Jan 07, 2025 10:32 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

After India’s loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series, Rohit Sharma clarified that his recent comments regarding stepping out did not signal his retirement. However, the BCCI officials reportedly dismissed his remarks.

  • The BCCI Special General Meeting is scheduled, with discussions expected about Rohit's future in Test cricket.
  • Rohit scored only 31 runs in five innings during the tour of Australia, marking a troubling average.
  • His clarification to the media included the statement, “I am not going anywhere.”
  • According to sources within the BCCI, Rohit's comments did not significantly alter the board's perspective on his future.
  • Officials suggested that Rohit was looking for an escape route to the World Test Championship final.
“Rohit was waiting to see if India could find an escape route to the WTC final. Now, it’s really up to him whether to continue to fight for a spot.” – BCCI official

The discussion at the BCCI meeting will be crucial in determining the path forward for both Rohit and the Indian team as they navigate the upcoming Champions Trophy and beyond.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah b - The Times of India
item.description:
EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah bowling 150-plus overs in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Published on: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's heavy bowling load during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he bowled over 150 overs. Former Indian pacer Balwinder Sandhu critiques the concept of workload management in cricket.

  • Bumrah bowled 151.2 overs and took 32 wickets during the series.
  • Concerns were raised about his physical limits due to the workload.
  • Sandhu argues that workload management is a concept created by Australians and insists that bowlers should listen to their bodies.
  • He emphasizes that bowlers are capable of managing such workloads with proper conditioning.
"Workload management is bull****. These are Australian terms, created by Australians. I don’t agree with this at all," said Balwinder Sandhu.

The article highlights an ongoing debate in cricket regarding player workload and the expectations placed on bowlers in Test matches.

item.title: Warning: Rocky road to Test revival of Team India - The Times of India
item.description:
Warning: Rocky road to Test revival of Team India

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team faces significant challenges following a tough series in Australia, necessitating changes before the upcoming Test series in England. The focus is on team composition, coaching decisions, and the performance of key players, particularly Bumrah, Kohli, and Rohit.

  • India failed to draw the recent Test series against Australia, suffering from poor performances.
  • Concerns arise over the conservative strategy of lengthening the batting order with allrounders.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's over-reliance led to his injury, affecting India's performance.
  • New head coach Gautam Gambhir faces scrutiny regarding team management.
  • Questions about the form and future of senior players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
“Ultimately, it is neither my team nor your team, it's the country's team.” - Gautam Gambhir

The challenges ahead for Team India are daunting, with leadership and strategy under scrutiny as they prepare for what promises to be a demanding series in England.

item.title: 'India had cooked its golden goose': Jasprit Bumrah's overlooked MCG moment that sparked workload fears, led to injury - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI's medical team has yet to give an official update on the degree of Jasprit Bumrah's apparent back injury.

Date: Jan 07, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah concludes his stellar series with injury concerns emerging from his exhaustion during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Bumrah took a record 32 wickets in the Australia Test series.
  • Injured on Day 2 of the Sydney Test, unable to return.
  • Concerns raised about his workload after a crucial performance at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Failed to recover fully from exertion as noted in training videos.
  • BCCI has not confirmed the degree of injury.
"The damage was done, even though it would not become evident for almost another week. India had cooked its golden goose," the report stated.

The future of Bumrah's participation in cricket remains uncertain pending further medical assessments.

item.title: First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Pakistan fought valiantly but ultimately lost to South Africa in the second Test at Cape Town, despite a remarkable 478 runs in the second innings while following on, led by captain Shan Masood's 145.

  • Pakistan set a record total of 478 while following on, the highest by a visiting team in South Africa in 136 years.
  • The previous record for the highest follow-on total was 372/7 by Australia in 1902.
  • Shan Masood's innings of 145 was pivotal along with significant contributions from Babar Azam (81) and other batsmen.
  • Despite the impressive total, South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs comfortably.
  • The win secured South Africa's top position in the World Test Championship table.
“It surpasses the previous best follow-on total of 372/7 set by Australia in Johannesburg in 1902.”

In conclusion, while Pakistan put up a historic performance, South Africa confirmed their dominance by clinching the series 2-0 and setting their sights on the upcoming World Test Championship final.

item.title: India's Squad For Champions Trophy: Not Hardik Pandya Or Shubman Gill, This Star To Be Vice-Captain,.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy Squad: Not Hardik Or Gill, This Star To Be Vice-Captain, Says Report

Date: 13 June 2024 | Source: NDTV

The announcement of India's squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is upcoming, with reports suggesting Rohit Sharma will captain and Jasprit Bumrah is expected to be vice-captain, pending recovery from injury.

  • Rohit Sharma is confirmed to lead India in the Champions Trophy.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is likely to be named vice-captain, replacing Hardik Pandya and Shubman Gill.
  • Bumrah's fitness is uncertain after an injury in the final Test against Australia.
  • The vice-captaincy role has seen significant changes in recent years.
“The vice-captaincy in limited-overs cricket has switched hands considerably.”

Should Bumrah be unable to play, it could lead to further debates on the vice-captaincy choice, leaving India with no clear frontrunner.

item.title: "Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer": Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection - Crictoday
item.description:
“Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer”: Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Shubman Gill faced criticism after a disappointing showing in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, underperforming compared to expectations set by a strong previous series.

  • Gill scored 13, 20, 1, 28, and 31 in the series, contributing to India's 1-3 loss.
  • Kris Srikkanth labeled Gill as overrated, questioning his continued selection over players like Suryakumar Yadav.
  • Srikkanth suggested that domestic performers Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sai Sudharsan should be considered over Gill.
  • Gill managed to survive selection due to rare performances, but Srikkanth emphasized the need for consistency in challenging conditions.
Kris Srikkanth: “Gill has managed to survive because he scores in one out of ten chances.”

The conversation around Gill's selection reflects broader discussions about player performance and meritocracy in the Indian cricket team.

item.title: Manu Bhaker's net worth was Rs 60 lakh before Paris Olympic, now her net worth has jumped to Rs.... - India.com
item.description:
Manu Bhaker's Net Worth Surge After Paris Olympics

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India.com

New Delhi: Ace shooter Manu Bhaker made history at the 2024 Paris Olympics, winning two bronze medals and becoming the first Indian woman to achieve such a milestone in shooting. Her financial journey has also seen substantial growth.

Key Points:

  • As of 2024, Manu Bhaker’s net worth is estimated at Rs 12 crore, up from Rs 60 lakh before the Olympics.
  • Her earnings are largely derived from her shooting career and endorsements with brands like Nothing India and Performax.
  • Female athletes in India typically earn between Rs 8 lakh to Rs 30 lakh per endorsement.
  • Reports indicate her brand value to be around Rs 1.5 crore.

Early Investments:

  • Bhaker started her journey with an initial investment of Rs 1.5 lakh from her father.
  • Organizations like Olympic Gold Quest (OGQ) have supported her financially.
  • She received Rs 12,16,257 from the Sports Authority of India (SAI) under the Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS).
  • Financial support from the Annual Calendar for Training and Competition (ACTC) amounted to Rs 1,50,67,390.

This financial backing has greatly aided her training and competitive endeavors.

Conclusion:

Manu Bhaker's rise in net worth reflects not only her success as an athlete but also the growing recognition and support for female sports in India.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma's hunger should show in his actions' - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's hunger should show in his actions

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Rohit Sharma is reminded to demonstrate his hunger for success through his performances on the field, emphasizing the need for players to convert talent into results.

  • Emphasis on Rohit Sharma's need to show his determination through actions.
  • Calls for players to translate their skills into on-field achievements.
  • Focus on the importance of motivation in sports performance.
“It's not enough to have talent; you must have the will to succeed.”

This article serves as a motivational reminder for athletes to back up their abilities with consistent performance.

item.title: Nottm Forest 3-0 Wolves (7 Jan, 2025) Game Analysis - ESPN India
item.description:
Nottm Forest 3-0 Wolves (7 Jan, 2025) Game Analysis

Publication Date: 7 Jan, 2025 | Source: ESPN (IN)

Nottingham Forest displayed a strong performance against Wolverhampton Wanderers, winning 3-0 and continuing their push for a possible title challenge.

  • Chris Wood scored his 12th Premier League goal this season.
  • Morgan Gibbs-White and Taiwo Awoniyi also contributed to the scoreline.
  • This marks Forest's sixth consecutive win, a first since 1979.
  • Forest's 40 points put them just six behind league leaders Liverpool.
  • Wolves struggled, remaining only out of relegation zone on goal difference.
"It is about consistency and doing what we have been doing extremely well already this season. Not letting up halfway through. We need to keep going," said Wood.

In summary, Nottingham Forest's decisive victory reinforces their potential as contenders in the Premier League.

item.title: Cricket Australia Reacts After Sunil Gavaskar's Complaint Over Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation Snub: 'I - News18
item.description:
Cricket Australia Reacts After Sunil Gavaskar's Complaint Over Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation Snub

Date: January 06, 2025

Source: News18

After Sunil Gavaskar expressed his disappointment at not being invited to join Allan Border in handing over the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Cricket Australia acknowledged the oversight.

  • Sunil Gavaskar was not invited to the trophy presentation for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Australia won the series against India 3-1, reclaiming the trophy.
  • Gavaskar expressed his desire to participate in the ceremony, stating that it is a representation of both nations.
  • A CA spokesperson acknowledged that both Gavaskar and Border should have been invited to the stage.
“It should not matter that Australia won when it comes to the presentation... Just because I am an Indian, I did not present the trophy.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The incident highlights the importance of inclusivity in sports recognition and events.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 18:17 IST

Jasprit Bumrah has sustained back spasms during the fifth Test between India and Australia, leading to concerns about his participation in the upcoming series against England.

  • Bumrah is expected to miss the majority of the white-ball series against England.
  • The extent of his injury is currently unknown, and a decision will be made based on that.
  • If it's a Grade 1 injury, recovery may take two to three weeks; a Grade 2 injury could require up to six weeks; a Grade 3 injury might lead to a three-month absence.
  • India will host England for five T20Is starting January 22, followed by three ODIs.
"The fresh blow has renewed focus on Bumrah’s workload and the Indian team’s overdependence on him."

The severity of Bumrah's injury will determine if he misses the entire ODI series or can participate in at least one match before the Champions Trophy in February.

item.title: Christian comes out of retirement to help injury-hit Thunder - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Dan Christian Returns from Retirement to Aid Sydney Thunder

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australian T20 legend Dan Christian comes out of retirement to help the injury-affected Sydney Thunder in the Big Bash League (BBL).

Christian, 41, last played for the Sydney Sixers and has served as an assistant coach at Thunder. He has been active in local cricket to maintain his fitness.

  • Christian is joining players in their 40s who compete in the BBL.
  • Thunder faces a mounting injury toll including Bancroft and Sams.
  • He aims to make an impactful return amidst the team's challenging season.
“I made the decision during the off season that a return to the BBL or any other T20 leagues was never entirely off the table for me.” - Dan Christian

Trent Copeland, Thunder's general manager, expressed excitement about Christian's return, emphasizing his capability and experience.

item.title: ‘I don’t think we are a well-oiled machine’: Temba Bavuma after South Africa defeat Pakistan in 2nd Test - The Indian Express
item.description:
Temba Bavuma Reflects on South Africa's Test Victory Over Pakistan

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

South Africa's captain, Temba Bavuma, expressed confidence in his team's performance after they secured their seventh consecutive Test win against Pakistan, but noted that they are still not functioning at their best.

  • Bavuma highlighted the need for improvement despite recent victories.
  • The team has reached the World Test Championship final after successful performances, including wins against West Indies, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka.
  • He emphasized the importance of mental preparation and adapting to different conditions ahead of the final against Australia at Lord's in June.
  • Bavuma mentioned internal competition as a motivating factor for the players.
“As much as we have got the success, I don’t think we are a well-oiled machine... There is something special brewing within the team, and it will be scary when we are firing on all cylinders.”

The South African team aims to capitalize on their current momentum and strive for excellence in upcoming matches.

item.title: Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria - Chess.com
item.description:
Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Chess.com

The reign of GM Magnus Carlsen as the king of chess now includes a queen.

  • Magnus Carlsen married Ella Victoria Malone in Oslo.
  • The ceremony took place at Holmenkollen Chapel with close family and friends.
  • The reception was held at Oslo's 5-star Grand Hotel.
  • Guests included sports figures, commentators, and Carlsen's long-time coach.
  • A Netflix film crew was present for a chess-related show.
  • Ella Victoria, now Carlsen, holds a multifaceted background having lived in Norway, the USA, and Singapore.

Sometimes it's difficult to come with him to these tournaments, but I do it anyway because I want to be a good girlfriend and support him, and it's something I'm getting used to.

—Ella Victoria Malone on her now husband Magnus Carlsen

Ella is expected to play a larger role in Carlsen's career, including securing sponsorship deals. Magnus continues to be active in competitive chess.

item.title: Virat-Anushka to Yuzi-Dhanashree, cricketers who married Bollywood actors - India TV News
item.description:
Virat Kohli-Anushka Sharma to Yuzi Chahal-Dhanashree Verma, Cricketers Who Married Bollywood Actors

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: India TV News

This article explores the marriages of prominent Indian cricketers with Bollywood actresses, shedding light on both joyous unions and their occasional controversies.

  • Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have been together since 2017 and are now parents.
  • Yuzi Chahal and Dhanashree Verma are reportedly facing divorce rumors after unfollowing each other on Instagram.
  • Hardik Pandya and Natasa Stankovic married in 2020 but have since separated while co-parenting.
  • Yuvraj Singh and Hazel Keech married in 2016 and have two children.
  • Harbhajan Singh tied the knot with actress Geeta Basra after five years of dating.
  • Mohammad Azharuddin's marriage to actress Sangeeta Bijlani was a major talking point in the 90s due to their eventual divorce.
  • Sharmila Tagore married cricket legend Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi in 1968 and has three children.
“Marriages between cricketers and Bollywood stars have always intrigued fans, with each pairing making headlines for various reasons.”

This article not only highlights these marriages but also reflects on the impact of celebrity relationships in both the cricket and film industries.
